wikipedia_page.main: Graeme Alexander Lockhart Whitelaw (1863 – 23 July 1928) was a British Conservative Party politician from Scotland who represented North West Lanarkshire in the House of Commons from 1892 to 1895.He was the second son of Alexander Whitelaw and an elder brother of William Whitelaw, grandfather of William Whitelaw, 1st Viscount Whitelaw.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1892 United Kingdom general election

response: William Whitelaw (15 March 1868 – 19 January 1946) was a Conservative and Unionist Party politician in Scotland and a long serving railway director and chairman. He was the third son of Alexander Whitelaw and a younger brother of Graeme Whitelaw.
